decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Thug, and Grief in order to bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard. Using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Noxious Revival, the deck aims to continuously dredge through the graveyard to establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and graveyard synergies. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to protect its combo pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through artifact acceleration and land cards to play powerful aggro creatures and disruptive artifacts early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with fast and efficient threats. It also utilizes synergy between artifacts like Time Vault and Manifold Key to generate extra turns and lock down the opponent's resources. The strategy is to maintain strong board presence and control while pressuring the opponent to win the game quickly before they have a chance to mount a defense.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana and artifact synergies to quickly assemble the Coveted Jewel combo, generating a massive advantage by drawing cards and ramping mana. Key pieces include Mishra's Workshop, The One Ring, and Paradoxical Outcome, supported by powerful artifacts like Voltaic Key and Mana Crypt. Furthermore, the inclusion of Tinker, Time Vault, and Time Walk provide additional combo potential, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and mana acceleration.

This deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion, while cards like Psychic Frog provide card advantage. The deck also utilizes powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain an advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, outvalue the opponent, and secure a victory through efficient play and resource management.

This MUD aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland, Sphere of Resistance, and Trinisphere. The deck also utilizes artifact synergy with cards like Mishra's Workshop, Sol Ring, and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to bring out powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Lodestone Golem. With a mix of disruption, mana acceleration, and big threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Combo - Paradoxical Outcome strategy to quickly generate card advantage and mana acceleration. By combining cards like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and various Moxen, the deck aims to draw through its library rapidly and generate large amounts of mana to play powerful spells like Time Walk and Thundertrap Trainer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the game while building up its resources to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden and explosive victory.

This deck aims to generate infinite mana and draw its entire library using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Underworld Breach. It utilizes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to ramp quickly and chain together spells to eventually win the game with a Brain Freeze combo. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion, allowing for additional recursion and flexibility in the deck strategy. The deck focuses on speed, efficiency, and combo potential to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and drawing cards quickly to assemble its combo pieces. It utilizes cards such as Paradoxical Outcome, Underworld Breach, and Stock Up to generate value and dig deeper into the deck. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a turn, combo off, and win the game in a single explosive turn. It also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect the combo. The deck is designed to be fast, resilient, and capable of winning the game out of nowhere.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By using cards like Moxen, Mana Crypt, and Grim Monolith to ramp up mana production, along with Tezzeret, Karn, and Mystic Forge to manipulate the board and create advantage, the deck aims to apply pressure early and lock down the opponent's resources. With powerful finishers like Time Vault and The One Ring, the deck seeks to close out the game swiftly before the opponent can establish their own strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering and disrupting the opponent's strategy while utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. With key cards like Show and Tell and Ancestral Recall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of combo pieces like Flash and Atraxa, Grand Unifier allows for game-ending plays, while the extensive mana base and powerful artifacts provide consistency and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to dictate the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with its versatile and potent threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba, Golgari Thug, and Stinkweed Imp, while also using cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam to drain the opponent's life. By constantly dredging and bringing back creatures from the graveyard, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Grief to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The key strategy is to create a powerful board presence from the graveyard and win the game quickly.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing powerful Azorius cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Swords to Plowshares to control the opponent's board while also having aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Quantum Riddler to apply pressure and win the game quickly. The deck also includes efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its threats, along with disruptive creatures like Containment Priest to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using powerful control cards to disrupt your opponent's game plan, while also utilizing the Gifts Ungiven package to search for key combo pieces and graveyard recursion. It aims to control the game by countering threats, removing opposing permanents, and generating card advantage through powerful draw spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing you to repeatedly bring back cheap permanents from the graveyard. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient control play.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly to play disruptive artifacts and large threats early in the game. It aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Scrawling Crawler and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck can also utilize powerful artifacts such as Mystic Forge and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to generate card advantage and find important pieces. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a combination of resource denial, disruption, and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells, removal, and disruption to outlast and outpace opponent's threats. It aims to control the game with cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Spell Pierce while using efficient card draw and selection with cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Brainstorm. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional recursion and value for the deck. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hatebears like Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Anointed Peacekeeper while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. With disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Void Mirror, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slow them down while still maintaining a strong board presence. The deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration through Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats and lock down the opponent's options.
